title: Brazil group says it has recommended planned Petrobras general strike be called off
text:
FILE PHOTO: Tanks are seen at Revap refinery controlled by Brazilian state oil company Petrobras, in Sao Jose dos Campos, Brazil September 30, 2019. REUTERS/Roosevelt Cassio

SAO PAULO (Reuters) - Brazilian oil worker’s federation FUP said on Friday it has recommended the unions representing workers at state-controlled oil company Petrobras call off a planned general strike after receiving a new contract proposal.

Several unions had called for a general strike at Petrobras as part of contract negotiations, arguing the oil company was offering raises that were too low.
